meanings.definition: A form of government in which power is shared by two rulers.
meanings.sent1: In diarchies, two rulers work together to lead the country.
meanings.sent2: The diarchies system allows for power to be divided between two leaders.
meanings.sent3: The diarchies arrangement can sometimes lead to disagreements between the rulers.
meanings.sent4: The concept of diarchies is like having two captains steering the same ship.
meanings.sent5: The idea of diarchies is similar to having a duo of kings ruling together.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a diarch.
meanings.sent1: She was appointed to the diarchies after the previous ruler retired.
meanings.sent2: The diarchies is responsible for making important decisions for the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: Being in the diarchies means having to share authority with another person.
meanings.sent4: The prestige of the diarchies is akin to being a co-leader of the nation.
meanings.sent5: The role of the diarchies requires cooperation and collaboration with the other ruler.

meanings.definition: The period during which a diarchy is in power.
meanings.sent1: During the diarchies, both rulers must work together effectively.
meanings.sent2: The diarchies can bring stability or conflict depending on the rulers.
meanings.sent3: The diarchies era was marked by significant diplomatic achievements.
meanings.sent4: The diarchies reign symbolized a unique balance of authority.
meanings.sent5: The time of diarchies showcased the benefits of shared leadership.
